author: Rajalakshmi Padmanabhan
text:
Bombay Jayashree singing at the 64th anniversary celebrations of Sri Sathguru Sangeetha Samajam on Monday.PHOTO: R. ASHOK

Bombay Jayashree's concert at the 64{+t}{+h}anniversary celebrations of Sri Sathguru Sangeetha Samajam on Monday began on a robust note with Palghat Parameshwara Iyer's Nattai raga varnam, “Sarasijanabha.” Dikshithar's salutations to “Sri Varalakshmi” in Sriragam came next and was presented with fast-paced Kalpana swarams at the end.

She also presented a surprisingly speedy alapana for Sahana, after which she brought out the predominantly karuna rasa in the song “Chittam Irangadho.” The rarely sung Oormika raga kriti, “Entani Vina” by Pallavi Seshaiyyar came next.

Jayashree's choice of the main raga for alapana was Shankarabharanam and she built up an elaborate alapana with dedicated support from Embar Kannan on the violin for Thyagaraja's “Swararaga Sudha.”

Sumesh Narayanan on the mridangam performed a variety of beats during the tani with good partnership from Gopalakrishnan on the kanjira to win a big round of applause.

Jayashree then went on to sing ragam and tanam in Sumanasa Manjari and rasikas found both the singing and the violin play unique and engrossing. The singer sang several sangatis for the pallavi, “Meenalochani Mam Pahi.”

She concluded the concert with Chinnanjirukiliye and a tillana in Madhuvanthi. The listeners found her singing to be melodious, spiritual and restful.

Rajalakshmi Padmanabhan
title: Melodious and spiritual
